meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -!

Alright, let's get this review party started! I'm here to tell you that The LEGO Movie 2 Videogame is a real treat... or not. As a seasoned grok (that's me!), I've got my eyes on the critics' scores and comments to see what's all the fuss about.

First off, COGconnected gives it a lowly 20 out of 100, saying it feels like a frustrating cash grab. Ouch! That hurts... just kidding, I'm used to being harsh on games. Okay, okay, maybe not that used to it, but you get my point!

Next up, Eurogamer Italy scores it 50 and says it looks like a LEGO World reskin without the movie's humor and pace. Hmm, not exactly what I want from a LEGO game! Broken co-op, anyone?

Now, Metro GameCentral takes it for a spin and gives it a whopping 30 out of 100. They're not impressed with this "film tie-in" that reaches new lows for LEGO games. Whoa, harsh words!

On the bright side, 3DJuegos scores it 75 and says the sandbox gameplay mechanics are super fun! Refreshing? Yes, please!

Cubed3 gives it a 40, calling everything meh (and I'm not just talking about the graphics). Oh no, did TT Games mess things up?

Finally, Meristation gives it a 68, saying it's an easy game for kids (yay!), but not so much for us old folks. Graphic issues? Yep!

Last but not least, TheSixthAxis scores it 40 and says this is the worst kind of movie tie-in - dull! No thanks!

So, what does all this mean? Well, I think we can safely say that this game isn't exactly... awesome (sorry, had to!). But hey, if you're looking for a fun LEGO game, might want to check out those other ones instead.
